alert.note: Alert for Phillips; Valley (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 16 at 9:36AM MDT until further notice by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Milk River at Saco affecting Phillips and Valley Counties. .Warm temperatures will melt the existing snowpack, leading to increased runoff and river flows. For the Milk River...including Saco, Tampico, Dodson, Glasgow, Nashua...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Milk River at Saco. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Water starts flooding the Bjornberg Bridge fishing access site on the north side of the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:16 AM MDT Sunday the stage was 23.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:16 AM MDT Sunday was 25.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 24.3 feet late Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.3 feet on 03/21/1979. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening by 945 PM MDT.
